column4: I have added a new SATA HDD to my laptop. I booted first into WINXP and let it 'initialize' the disc and made a basic NTFS partition. That's fine but...
I can't see it from Ubuntu 8.04 even with 'parted' 'print -a' any ideas?
is this a windows channel?
I can't see my new SATA disc - any help out there. (I've already turned on the light and opened the curtains :-) )
are you running livecd
badfish this is ubuntu 8.04 on my laptop. stable for ages. just added this new hardware. must be in bios 'cause WinXp ses it.
read write but not the os
I don't understand.
You cant install ubuntu on ntfs
I've already got Ubuntu!! I'm trying to access my new hardware.
sudo fdisk -l   lets have a look
aha. Now I see it. /dev/sdb1, Id=7, System = HPFS/NTFS
can you mount manually
I'll try again.
no.
sudo mkdir /media/test                 then sudo mount /dev/sdb1 /media/test
is that what you tried.
yes.
what error if any
none, it just gives me a list of usage information as if I typed something wrong.
make sure the mount point exists and that you didnt use cap on one and not the other
silly me. Itried to creat a directory calle 'Storage 2' but of course I only created one called 'Storage'. All fixed now. Thanks also badfish .
